text:
The Art of PotteryUnit–V : The World of Things
17
Thousands of years ago, when early man learn t to cook food he needed 
vessels to store food and water. For this, he made earthen pots out of wet clay. 
He shaped the wet clay into different shapes by his hands. These wet pots 
were dried in the sun but they were not very strong.  They could be used to 
store dry things only and not for water because they would break. The 
invention of wheel and discovery of fire chang ed the human civiliz ation 
forever. People learn t tha t baking their cla y vessels in fir e would mak e them 
stronger and w ater could be s tored in them. The y also learn t tha t the wheel 
could be used to mak e well-shaped and smooth pots much faster. They also 
learn t to dec orate their pots with beautiful designs and pa tterns. This led t o 
the art of pottery.
The P otter's Wheel
The potter's wheel has a round and flat wooden surface. It is made to spin around a 
stick as the potter shapes clay on it.Starter
! Have you ever seen this pot?
! What is it called?
! Why is it used?
! What is it made of?
You mus t have seen a gullak (piggy bank), cup (kulhad), toys and man y such things 
made of clay, at home and around you. Do you know, who mak es them and how?
Environmental Studies-3113Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOW

Making P ottery
The art of making things out of clay is called pottery. It is one of the oldes t forms of 
art. It is a step by step process. The steps are described belo w–
! The first step to making pottery is to choose the right clay. Some times potters 
add ash, chalk or sand to mak e the clay better for pottery.
! Then water is added, just enough so that the potter is able to knead the clay 
well and mak e it into a lump.
! Now, the potter puts are lump of wet clay in the centre of the wheel and spins 
it to shape it into different objects such as pots and bowls.
! Once the objects are shaped, they are remo ved from the wheel using a thin 
thread or knife.
! The pots are then baked in fire.
!  In the end pottery is decorated.
The oven used to bake pottery is called kiln.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Our Values–  Pottery is made with great skill and labour . It should be handled 
carefully so that it does not break.
Simi is the daugh ter of a Potter. She is too young to use 
the potter's wheel. But, she help s her father in making 
beautiful patterns on the pots and colouring them. She 
loves doing this.
Activity TimeActivity TimeActivity Time
Making your own clay
! Collect some soil from a muddy place.
! Using a sieve, remove big pebbles, leaves and other things from it.
! Put this fine soil in a vessel filled with water.
! After few days, throw awa y the water that stays on top.
! Now knea d this soil to mak e dough that can be mould ed into any shape.
! Try to mak e any toy from this clay.How do y ou help y our par ents?
Environmental Studies-3 114

Pottery in Our Lives
Though the use of pottery has declined in cities, it still plays a signific ant role in 
Indian rituals and festivals. Earthen Lamp s are lit during Diwali. Decorated clay pots 
are used on Pongal. Besides this, pottery is very much used in everyday life in rural 
areas–
! Large clay pots are used to boil milk. 
! Kundi is used to set curd. 
! Handi is used to cook dal and saag.
!  Matka and Surahi are used to cool water in summer s.
! Kulhads are used to have tea.
! Clay pots are used to grow plan ts.
Indian P ottery
Indian pottery is famous all over the world. Different areas of our country have 
different styles of making pottery. Azamg arh in Uttar Pradesh is famous for black 
pottery with silver work on it. Khurja in Uttar Pradesh and Jaipur in Rajas than are 
famous for blue pottery. Khurja pottery includes pots, vases ,dinner sets ,mugs,e tc. 
They are very popular among people in cities.
Environmental Studies-3115

Environmental Studies-3 118

Things Around Us18
Starter
We can see through some objects very clearly but partially through some 
other s, while we cannot see through some objects at all. On the basis of this 
quality we can categorise them into three kinds– transpar ent, translucen t and 
opaque objects.! Wha t can you see thr ough the windo ws?
! Can y ou see the windo w glass? Wh y or wh y not?
! Can y ou see thr ough the curt ains or the w alls?
Environmental Studies-3119Unit–V : The World of Things
Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOW

Things through which we can see clearly are called transpar ent objects. Mos t kind 
of glass, air, pure water and some plastics are transpar ent materials.Transparent, T ranslucent and Opaque objects
Ther e are some materials through which we can see but not clearly . i.e. we can see 
through them partially . Such materials are called translucen t materials. Oily paper , 
butter paper , frosted glass, smok ed glass and some plastic are translucen t objects.
Around us we have mos t of the materials through which we cannot see at all. Such 
materials are called opaque  materials. Example of opaque objects are wood, 
metals ,brick s ,stones, cardboar d ,etc. 
Wher e do all these materials come from?
Wood– We get wood from trees. Cutting trees causes environmen t problems. We 
should use wood wisely .
Glass–  Glass is mos tly made of sand. We should not throw broken glass pieces into 
Environmental Studies-3 120

the soil because they cause harm to the soil. Instead, glass can be recycled in 
factories.
Metals– Metals are extracted from certain rocks and sedimen ts dug up from inside 
the earth. The rocks and sedimen ts which contain metals are called ores. examples 
of metals are- iron, copper , aluminium ,gold, silver, etc. 
When two or more metals are mixed together, they form alloys. Examples of alloys 
are steel, brass ,bronze ,etc.
Excessiv e digging of metals may cause short age of metals inside the earth and our 
futur e gener ations would not get enough metals for their use. 
Metals c an be r ecycled.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Your study table is made of wood or may have some metal. Can we use fabric or 
rubber to mak e a table? Why?
We see a  large variety of objects around us. Some are hard, some are soft.
Some have a definite shape and some not. Some materials like water can flow 
while some materials like air cannot be seen.
Depending on their properties materials can be classified as- solids, liquids and 
gases.
Solids– The things which do not chang e their shape are called solids. Examples of 
solid objects are- table, chair , brick ,stone ,wall ,etc.
Liquids– Water does not keep its shape. It flows and takes the shape of the 
container . Such materials are called liquids. Some other examples of liquids are- 
milk, cold drink s, juices, syrup s etc. 
Gases– Have you ever seen air? Obviously not. Air can not be seen but felt. Air flows 
too, but in a different way. If we pour water or milk in a cup, it stays there. Air does 
not stay in a cup, it just flows in and out. It is because air is a gas. Some other 
examples of gases are- smok e ,steam, CNG ,PNG ,etc. 
You will study the properties of solids, liquids and gases in detail in further classes.Properties of Some Materials
Environmental Studies-3121
